name: Le Royal Meridien Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 days in July 2013, as part of a 2-stop trip (Singapore first) for our 25th wedding anniversary. We had advised the hotel of our special occasion, and had booked a few things such as airport transfers (worth it so as you don't have to get in a taxi with one of Dubai's homicidal drivers) and dinner in Rhodes Twenty10. When we got to the hotel, we were upgraded to a deluxe suite - a simply stunning, massive room with wonderful views over the pools, beach and sea beyond. The fact that it was Ramadan probably meant the hotel was quieter than normal but that suited us fine.
reviews.title: A stay to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: The pool area is great - loads of beds, very comfortable compared to most and the regular delivery of cold towels and ice was most welcome, as temps hit 44C through the day.
reviews.title: A little taste of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the restaurant was really good too - everything seemed really fresh with a great choice. We had breakfast in our suite on our anniversary also which was fantastic. Later that day the hotel delivered bubbly, a chocolate cake and flowers to our room which just exemplified how we were made to feel special throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Many others have commented that the hotel is a bit older than some in Dubai - probably true but still presented beautifully, and more than just the glitz that makes a hotel special, you need a certain extra something and Le Royal Meridien has it in spades.
reviews.title: The best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff throughout the hotel were wonderful from first to last - the attention to detail and extra effort taken by the staff was second to none and the stay will linger long in the memory, we just wish we had stayed a little longer!
reviews.title: Perfect in every way........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Well where do I begin? Ive never wrote a review on any hotel before and always had the intention of doing so regarding LRM but never got round to it..... We have just returned from another 15 night stay and it being our ninth visit here but this year with our first child 8 & half months old. Previous visits have always been fantastic and faultless but this year they excelled!! From start to finish the staff treated our little boy (and us)like royalty and NOTHING was to much trouble for them, as this was our first holiday with a baby it was a little worrying and daunting but the whole experience was made much easier by the hotel, he had his meals puréed and delivered to our room every night presented beautifully and prepared just as I'd asked. Every single member of staff had genuine care and concern for our little one and adored him like they do with most children I noticed.
reviews.title: Once again outstanding, gets better and better!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was without dought the most memorable holiday we have shared with LRM due to fact we could share it with our son, I have often read negative comments from others on here and although i understand everybody's requirements/opinions are different it saddens me as this hotel is amazing and doesn't deserve criticism. What you do get is a hotel that kind of feels like a second home and yes maybe not as fancy and new as most of the other hotels but you will not get the service and care that the staff at LRM naturally provide. The staff defiantly are what make this hotel so special and we have made many friends here!
reviews.title: Well what can I say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hope to return many more years to LRM and they see our little boy grow up as they have done so with so many other children. Thank you once again for a totally amazing holiday!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent .Just returned after 5 days at this fantastic Hotel. I Can only say this is one of the one of the very best Hotels I have stayed in. I cant understand why some people on this site say that it's dated and needs bringing upto date I could not find fault with any of the standards or the excellent service given by all the staff. Food I must all so say was to a very high standard This was my first Time to Dubai and it will not be my last As Arnie says I will be back to this Hotel .
reviews.title: Feel Good Factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again to all the management and team Thank you so much for making our stay a happy and comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the LRM 15th October for 7 nights loved every minute of it. When we checked in we were upgraded from a club room to a tower room which was lovely, from cakes and fruit everynight in the room and a birthday cake on the 20th. The breakfast was fantastic everything you could want for and our daughter never made breakfast so they would always make sure her's was sent to the room. The club room from afternoon tea and drinks in the evening nothing was too much trouble Wilma was always there and my husbands beer was always there for him by his same chair.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to dubai 6 times now and we will be back next year in June for our 2 week holiday and it will be at the LRM, just cannot wait.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after a long flight we arrived at the hotel to be greeted by smiling faces (it was 1.30 in the morning).we where checked in straight away and was given cool towels to refresh us and a glass of fresh orange juice this was only the start of the fab service which we received from all members of staff during our stay.we have stayed in some wonderful hotels over the years but never one that had everything that this hotel had to offer.although it is very beautiful it had that lovely homely feeling which unfortunaly alot of new modern hotels lack look forward to our next visit which hopefully will be in june 20011
reviews.title: One of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel because the rate was very gogd and constantly good reviews from the past guests.
reviews.title: The best Hotel EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I must say the hotel exceeded our expectations. The decor was may be old style, but very clean and airy. The room was rather standard by Dubai standards, but we got the sea-view, which was great.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Dubai??
Fantastic!!!!!
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel - apart from the argument over our room not being ready until after 2pm whilst we had been waiting around since 9:00am!! However we did get upgraded to the Tower Suite with wine and champagne on tap for 5 days!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Excellent service. Good food - Prime rib restaruant is fab - definately no issues on reccommending this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Ideal weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Had a 4 night break in early June, and had a wonderful time. Arrived at hotel around 7.30a.m., but a room was immediately available for us - maybe because the hotel was not full. Paid a supplement for a club room which was was well worth the money - club lounge offered free soft drinks all day, and afternoon tea and pre-dinner drinks and canapes at no additional cost. The only minor niggle was that the 'no smoking' club room quickly filled up and we had to sit outside on the terrace.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel... However...
fabulous
reviews.text: Service both in the hotel and around the pools and gardens was very good throughout our stay. The staff were attentive and courteous at all times, nothing ever seemed to be too much trouble.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast was unbeatable - enough to keep you going all day. Although we only ate in three of the restaurants, the food and service were well up to '5 Star' standard, the Fusion restaurant being our favourite.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Spent a week at the LRM arriving on the 7th July. It was my other halfs 50th and our first time in Dubai. I researched long and hard about where to stay and pleased to say we made the right choice. I have stayed in a number of 4 and 5* hotels all over the world so I can compare. Let's be clear, LRM does not have the biggest or most opulent rooms you will ever find, I guess partly because its one of the older hotels but dont take that to mean old fashioned, it is not. We went for a club room and that's worth the extra but not really for the room size, more on that later. The room is big enough with a small balcony. Club rooms are in the tower, we were on the 14th floor with great views over the marina, looking out to the Atlantis and the Burj Al Arab in the distance. A note on the aircon in the room. It's a real bug bear of mine, usually it's to noisy and you can't get it to regulate itself properly. Not this, you could hardly hear it and room temp was maintained perfectly allowing a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Classy, established top quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was a little small with only one sink (here is where it shows its age a bit) but nevertheless a great shower and bath with everything top quality. The mini bar was a normal fridge not one of those touch and get charged ones which was welcome so you could put a few things of your own in. Finally on the room, everything worked, it was very comfortable and lacked nothing.
reviews.title: Perfect wedding setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: What really sets this hotel apart is the ambience it creates and the quality of service as you have seen in other reviews. By ambience I mean everything seems relaxed, comfortable and genuine. One night we went to eat at the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. It's impressive but we felt we were in a theme park and even outside in its grounds felt a little claustrophobic. LRM by contrast always felt roomy and spacious overall inside and out.
reviews.title: more than I imagined.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So what are the bad bits? Well as I've said room size may be perceived as small by some, for us it was big enough. A few minor bits look a bit old (furniture, decor maybe??) fashioned in the room, yet you have a 42" plasma and free wifi. Mini bar prices are ridiculous by any standards - hint - go to the supermarket but your own soft drinks unless you want to pay circa £4 for a coke. Alcohol is expensive everywhere in Dubai. At best you may find prices equal to UK city centre prices, at worst £8 a pint or £40 for a basic bottle of wine. Hint - go into Dubai duty free on your way in and take some with you to the hotel if you are a drinker!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shades, one of the restaurant / bars has happy hour between 8 and 10 where selected beers, wine and cocktails are half price and far more reasonable akin to to home.
reviews.title: Perfection in a hotel and resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived from a stunning 5 star boutique hotel in Sri Lanka slightly worried at booking a polar opposite hotel like this but they definitely didn't fail us. As soon as you arrived the concierge guys were out helping laughing and joking 24/7 what a welcome as they did every night. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary so they upgraded us into a giant room when we thanked the staff we were contacted by the hotel manager Mark Kirby and met up for tea. Mark was very warm and helpful beyond the call of duty. The room service the breakfast service and the general service all over the hotel is impeccable, the restaurants are very good especially the new Rhodes Twenty 10 please don't miss this it's a big treat. The Pastries and bread in all of he breakfast restaurants are a real treat. The beach boys and pool boys are all extremely attentive as are the 'Sri Lankan baywatch' haha. Don't forget to visit their sister hotel the Grosvenor which is quite amazing with the same high standards as is the buzzin' Buddha Bar Cocktail bar. Most European so called 5 Star resorts should take big leaf out of the Le Meridian book because the service level is night and day in comparison. The staff from top to bottom work tirelessly to keep up these high standards and I mus applaud them. This place comes very highly recommended and we will definitely return.
reviews.title: Exemplary Service and True 5 STAR!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Have just enjoyed yet another fabulous10 nights at this wonderful hotel and cannot praise it enough! Sounds unbelievable but its all true and all the awards this hotel has won speaks volumes. The LRM experience is something everyone should try! From the moment you walk through the door from check in to check out it is unbelievably good. The staff are all wonderfully friendly with nothing too much trouble, always a smile and with calm efficiency. They make you feel like "Royalty"!! The rooms are fabulous, stayed in the tower with sea view, the beds are soooo big and sooo comfortable and the pillows are just heavenly. Pools and outside spaces are beautiful and so well kept. The restaurants are all so welcoming and the food superb. Rhodes 2010 is simply devine, food and service second to none. Al Khaima is another superb restaurant........love the different flavours and perfect service and so lovely to be able to sit out under the stars and watch traditional belly dancing and listen to Turkish music!! Sea Breeze is also really good and great for families and to be able to sit out on the terrace at night, as is the Pizzeria for simple but excellent meals - sheer magic. We have also tried some of the restaurants at the 'sister' hotels - Grosvenor House namely Sloanes, Ottoman and Bhudda Bar, and Tower Two with Embassy Club, Toro Toro and the very elegant Siddharta Lounge, (buses provided by LRM) and these are also well worth visiting. All very different but all equally as good. Service and quality of food excellent - never had a bad meal in any of them. The pool service is always good, the staff are impeccably trained to look after guests every need. Food and drinks etc arrive quickly, all with politeness and a smile. The Spa is second to none... a must for the complete relaxation experience! Already looking forward to yet another trip later this year.
reviews.title: The Royal Treatment
Simply the Best
reviews.text: I have recently returned from another fabulous stay at LRM. As ever we received a genuinely warm welcome from the delightful staff who took care of us for the following 10 days. One almost loses the power of thought such is the attention to every need we could possibly have! Having stayed at many hotels around the world I can honestly say that the service here is incomparable. Our suite was luxurious and well appointed with the most comfortable beds and we had a lovely view over the beautifully landscaped gardens and beach. We enjoyed long relaxing days in the gardens where plenty of shade was available along with a choice of pools in which to cool off. The Pool Bar staff could not do enough for us and even provided outdoor air conditioning units! In the evening we dined in the many and varied restaurants that LRM has to offer and can particularly recommend Al Khaima and Rhodes 2010, both first class. The only downside to this trip was having to leave!! Really can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have travelled to Dubai many times and this is the second time we have stayed at the Le Royal Meridien and we were not disappointed. Our rooms were spotless and clean thanks to Karthik who worked on the 7th floor while we stayed from the 23rd-30th August. He was incredibly polite and helpful and it is due to staff like him and the incredible service they provide that would make us come back again and again. We would not consider staying at any another hotel because everything was perfect.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday
Brilliant!
reviews.text: Have just got home and wanted to record my thoughts. My mobility was a bit restricted due to recent knee surgery but I didn't need to worry. Nothing was too much trouble - all the staff were superb. From the minute we arrived we felt special and were remembered and acknowledged as returning guests. Kirti is mega efficient and even made special efforts to come and find us to say hello. Special thanks to Joshi, Lovu, Rohit, and their colleagues at the Penguin Bar and the nearby towel hut. I was waited on hand and foot every day without ever having to ask. They were a credit to their manager and the hotel. The service everywhere in the hotel was outstanding as ever and is the main reason for us returning. The food was way too good for my waistline! We love this hotel and will be back again next year. We are not wealthy and have to save up to go, but it is worth every hard earned penny. Thanks again for a wonderful week and see you next year. For anyone not sure, give it a go, you won't be disappointed. Karen Kendal and Sharon Merryweather.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back (31st Aug 2012) from our first visit to Dubai and this hotel. You are looked after as soon as you arrive (just get out of the car and let them do the rest). While checking in they will offer a cooling drink as well as a cold hand cloth (both well needed). We were shown to our room right away (not bad considering this was 9.00am), this allowed us to get to the pool ASAP. The rooms are excellant (we choose a sea view), you get slippers and bath robes and lots and lots of free bottles of water (great for taking down to the pool). As well as room service every morning, around 2.00 or 3.00 pm they come by the room and leave fresh fruit (changed daily) and around 5.00 or 6.00pm you get the turndown service, chocolates on the pillow, fresh ice in the bucket. That reminds me, you have an ice bucket in the room but when you need it filled (dont go looking for the ice machine as I did), just press 0 on the phone tell them what you want and it will be brought to you.
reviews.title: Superb place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a bed and breakfast basis and the food is superb, so much choice (my wife being vegetarian was also very happy with what was avilable).
reviews.title: Service - you wont get better!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By the pool they will bring over ice buckets for your water, supply cold hand towels and cold water sprays to keep you cool (and there are plenty, plenty of sun beds so no need to get up at 6.00am to "bag" one).
reviews.title: LRM Just keeps getting better....
Fantastic hotel, highly recommended
reviews.text: Their "Bar Below" has a happy hour that starts at 10.00pm and its 30% off drinks (which brings the prices back to just below Edinburgh prices).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: When we stay at a new place we always ask ourselves would we come back and this time it would be yes please. Why try somewhere else (just in case its better?) you get it all here, the service is great, rooms superb, food excellant, just what you need from a good hotel.
reviews.title: best experience ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in June 2013 for 7 nights with my partner. Have been to Dubai many many times of the years and have stayed in many different hotels. This was my first stay at le royal meridian. The hotel was recommend to me by my parents as they have stayed on several occasions and loved it and was also very impressed by the reviews on trip advisor. The hotel gardens and beach are fantastic. We lay at the beach everyday on the luxurious sunbeds away from the busy main pool. I have stayed at larger resorts in dubai like jumeriah beach hotel and preferred the hotel grounds of le royal meridian as more accessible for walking in the heat and doesn't feel like your room is a long way away. The room was large and exceptionally clean and had everything we would need, the house keeper was especially good at giving us plenty of water everyday therefore never had to buy any during our stay. We had 2 queen beds even tho we'd requested a king but this was not an issue. The room however was dated amd could do with some modernisation. The bathroom was very small and in a 5 star hotel I expect a separate bath and shower. Although dated nothing looks tired or worn. The hotel is on a fantastic location at the very start of the jumeriah beach walk therefore never felt trapped into getting a taxi every night to go for dinner. Unlike other Dubai hotels I've stayed in, the staff although incredibly friendly never got to know us or remembered our faces. I would stay here again and by the amount of celebrities we spotted it's a very popular hotel but next time would definitely opt for a club room and not a room in the main building.
reviews.title: Fantastic location but in need of some modernisation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Without doubt Le Royal Meridien Resort Beach and Spa is the number one resort in the world.
reviews.title: Number 1 in the World!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The service standards staff and facilities could not be of a higher standard.
reviews.title: Great hotel on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive you are made to feel so welcome and every need is catered for.
reviews.title: Still top of the tree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tower suite was stunning and provided for a fantastic holiday.
reviews.title: Unreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a tower room with a great view of the sea and pools. Hotel and pools were lovely but it was the service that was outstanding. A very well run hotel in a good location on the beach. All the positive previous reviews are correct. Will be staying at this hotel again if we return to Dubai.
reviews.title: Fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Once again we returned to the "Le Royal Meriden Beach Resort & Spa". We just can't keep away. Every year gets better and better. The Customer Service from all the staff is excellent. They are all so friendly and attentive, always ready to help or assist or even just pass the time of day whenever you pass by.
reviews.title: Royal treatment at Le Royal Meridien for the 8th consecutive year.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The minute we arrive at the hotel we feel at home. The staff remember us from the previous year and make us feel at home immediately. We were lucky enough to be in a suite which was fantastic. We were taken to our suite straight away on arrival. The rooms are always so immaculate and the beds are so very comfortable. They have king size beds and the pillows are to die for. They have become so popular that many guests buy them from the hotel including us.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pam Wilby the general manager and her team are to be congratulated on the marvellous hotel that they run. They now have the new "Rhodes 2010" restaurant that has a lovely ambience and the food is delicious.
reviews.title: Just as good as the first time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our favourite restaurant this year was “Fusion” the Thai restaurant. Albert and his staff went out of their way to make our evenings so very special. The Mexican restaurant “Mia” is also worth a visit. John and his staff also went out of their way to make our evening so special. They have a new menu now that includes the more traditional but also the everyday Mexican food that you would expect to get.
reviews.title: Did I believe the Tripadvisor Reviews?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the LRM at the end of June. We had read a lot of reviews beforehand but I was still surprised as to how great this hotel is. This was our second visit to Dubai but the first stay at this hotel. From start to finish it was a wonderful experience and would definitely return again to this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel & Service
FAB !!!
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at around 8am and although check- in was not until 12pm, the staff tried to find us a room as early as posible. Much to my amazement we were upgraded from a Standard seaview room to a Tower Room at no cost. It is just down to luck as to whether you get an upgarde on arrival but I guess you stand a better chance during the off-peak season when the hotel is operating at about 50% occupancy.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The Tower rooms are fantastic and the service is excellent. The views are great but some rooms like ours have views of the new towers on one side and the sea on the other. I would strongly recommend the Tower Rooms. The Tower Rooms have a seperate bath/shower, tolietries, complimentary bottle of wine each day, plus fruit, water, nibbles and chocolates. Each time you return to your room you seem to find something waiting for you. The rooms are cleaned at least twice a day and have the additional benefits of a CD and DVD player alhough we didn't really have the time to make use of these.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We were on a half board package which covered Breakfast and Dinner (excluding drinks at dinner). The Half Board does not cover lunch. Although there are some very nice restaurants at the hotel with various types of cuisines, we preferred to dine outside of the hotel in the evenings and get to see more of Dubai. We did eat in the Brasserie on a few occasions and the food was buffet style and there was always a wide variety of choice. The breakfast was great and if you are in the Tower room you have the choice of the Brasserie, Fusion and in-room options.
reviews.title: its okay but not amazing
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel has a number of bars. Satchmos tended to be very popular as a pre and post dinner venue. It was also quite a lively venue for the World Cup. We watched a few games there and some of the games at Rooftop Bar in the Royal Mirage. The Piano Bar is also a great venue for after dinner entertainment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We now stay at the Grosvenor House and use the LRM beach facilities and frequently dine there. We have been doing this since the Grosvenor opened and find it ideal as the rooms are just more luxurious! We understand that the Club Tower is undergoing renovation and might well give it another try in future.
reviews.title: We'll give it five!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach staff are courteous and very friendly, remember their guests and welcome you back with open arms. Mr. Ahmed, who has been there from the very beginning, is lovely and just cannot help you enough. The service from Messrs. Pasha and Ritesh from the beach bars is praiseworthy; they are delightful and hugely accommodating and manage their staff superbly.
reviews.title: Pure bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We usually start and finish our holiday dining experience at the Seabreeze, where the service is just right, the music low enough so you can have a conversation, and where you can get a decent piece of grilled hamour. What a shame they are closing, we will miss the Seabreeze very much in future!
reviews.title: A fantastic experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food and service at Al Khaima and Twenty10 are brilliant, although the service at Twenty Ten has become somewhat "hushed". We miss food at the Fusion, and could not take to Shades at all, where the music on the terrace was just too loud and it was impossible to converse.
reviews.title: Five star all the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We almost feel like part of the family at LRM and being there is like being home from home.
reviews.title: This is what you call 5 star treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 weeks at Le Royal Meridien in Dubai. This was our 4th stay at this hotel, and we were a little nervous about going back as we had heard so many things about the building work. I can honestly say that although there is a great deal of work being undertaken around the hotel, it does in no way, impinge on your holiday.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only thing I would have to say is that the Hotel is undertaking a bit of maintenance work within the grounds itself. We left on 18th July and at that time, the Al Khaima restaurant had been closed for approx 6 days due to refurbishment. This meant that the Tower Pool (or infinity pool) was not able to serve any food, you had to go to the main pool for this. I also heard that the Mi Vida had also been closed, and so for those staying in the Club rooms, you had to go the Brasserie for breakfast. Having said that, it made no difference to us and did not distract from enjoying our stay.
reviews.title: simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: As usual, the staff at the hotel were fantastic, only too happy to please. The food was as good as I remember. The buffet always amazes me at the value for money and the choice of breakfast and dinner it offers.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

likes.liked: — The friendliness of the staff they could not do enough for you.

reviews.title: Absolute luxury
reviews.text: I would most certainly recommend this hotel for anyone who wishes to have a relaxing holiday and be spoilt by the staff and the food. I have attached some photos which I hope will give you a good idea of the hotel and grounds.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!
reviews.text: Have a wonderful holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed from 22nd Oct to 26th Oct, when we arrived (8am in the morning) our room wasn't ready, but they immediatley gave us a complimentry room to go on with so we could freshen up etc. The minute you arrive at the hotel the concierge take your suitcases and take them to your room for you. When we moved into our Deluxe Sea View room, the concierge came and took the suitcases for us again. The hotel itself is stunning and the staff are extremley friendly and nothing is too much! The room was luxurious and the bathroom lovely, even giving you bathrobes and slippers. Whatever you asked for, it was with you within minutes. They have a turn down service and left little boxes of chocolates on the bed every night.
reviews.title: Stunning Luxury With Attentive Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gardens and pools are spotlessly clean with life guards at each pool ( there are 3) they also provide beach towels, so no need to take your own, and there is plenty of sunloungers for everyone.
reviews.title: Service, Service, Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is beautiful and the sea is lovely and warm although the sand is a bit hot to walk on! While you are on the beach, they come round with complimentary cold flannels, water sprays and slushies to cool you down. They also come round and ask if you require anything to eat or drink.
reviews.title: Maybe 5-star on paper, but not what you'd expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't eat at the hotel (we wanted to try out different restaruants) we did try the The Bar Below which was like a wine bar/night club, again excellent service from the staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did a number of trips to the Creek/Gold Souks and Burj Kalifa and shopping malls and if you are feeling like a celebrity the helicoptor trip from the Atlantis is a must!
reviews.title: Number one for a reason!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A returning customer to this wonderful resort. Was acknowledged as a return guest, which was a nice touch. Booked Executive Rooms which are worth the additional cost. Breakfasts continue to be fantastic too.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay & value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathrooms are looking a little outdated and could do with being slightly more modern but honestly, the staff and service make up for it all. So many hotels in the rest of the world could learn a thing or two from the UAE. Yes, it's pricey but worth every penny.
reviews.title: Fifteen and counting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks again for a fabulous holiday.
reviews.title: Yet another fantastic holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: So, from the title you can imagine that we have stayed here many times, since 1997 when the hotel was the Forte Grand, and an Oasis in the desert. Foward to 2012, and the hotel is now in the middle of the new Dubai Marina. The surroundings may have change but the quality has not; Service, Staff, Restaurants, and Beach facilities, the best in Dubai. The committement to excellence is ongoing, small changes each time you arrive which improve the customer experience and keep standards high. The staff do that extra little something that make you feel so special. The Senior Management are every present keeping a watchful eye but always in the background, the LRM is by far one of the best managed hotels which we have had the pleasure to stay. Pam Wilby and staff should be extremely proud of the awards that the hotels continues to receive. The whole experience is just fantastic. We shall return in November and look forward to the new "Level One" lounge and refurbished Mayo restaurant.
reviews.title: Brilliant anniversary trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from yet another brilliant holiday at LRM. The hotel, restaurants, beach and grounds are beautiful but what makes this hotel outstanding is their amazing staff. Never have we come across such genuinely caring and dedicated people who give so generously of themselves for our constant comfort and wellbeing. We discovered LRM by chance approx 6 years ago after many years of travelling the world and would not go anywhere else now. Our twice yearly visits are utter bliss and the kind and knowledgeable staff make us feel like we are returning "home to a second family" - not to mention like royalty. Genuinely ready smiles and personal recognition greet us on our arrival and it is all upwards from there. Everywhere is spotlessly clean and the food is always to an extremely high standard. Can hardly wait for our next visit and to meet these wonderful people again - each and every one a treasure and very special in their own right.
reviews.title: Returning guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: I stayed with my son at what i call Dubai's best Hotel!!!!!!.
reviews.title: A must stay place!!!!!!!!!!!!
terrific
reviews.text: I have never seen so much in my life the level of attention, and willingness to please. The service is genuine. One can see that the employees are proud, the hotel is extremely well maintained, and the rooms fabulous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We were in the tower suites where Hermes toilletrie is provided and butler service is available.
reviews.title: The best hotel in the world...
great
reviews.text: The pools were fabulous, the fitness center and Spa were very new, and the food in all of the restaurants, first class!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: A Must stay place!!!
reviews.title: Another excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel. The service was excellent. We actually booked at the wrong Le Meridien (mixed up the phone numbers on the website), but were still accommodated here within a few minutes despite the high season. While they cleared up the confusion we created, we were treated to juice and dates.
reviews.title: The reviews are right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent rooms with everything you need, no complaints. Not huge, but spacious and well-equipped. Great attention to detail, as expected from a hotel of this level. Chocolates and slippers with the turn-down service, one day I came to the room to find some freshly baked banana cake etc. Free internet.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb breakfast buffet, nothing missing. Even had sushi, veg and fresh honey. Nice pool area and gardens, including 3 pools with bar, wide beach, a ping-pong table, soccer goal.
reviews.title: You cannot beat Le Royal Meridien

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym and spa are fabulous. Big, excellently equipped gym rooms, 5 pool hammam, dry sauna, steam room, beauty parlour for the ladies, the works. The sauna and steam room are separated by gender, the hammam is not.
reviews.title: Brilliant again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Currently (Oct 10) there is a construction site to the South of the hotel, so some of the tower rooms are affected by this. It's not extremely loud, but you do hear the beeping when the construction vehicles back up. They work from about 8am-5pm, no night work.
reviews.title: Blissful hotel, wanted to take the staff home with me !!!

description: Le Royal Meridien Beach Resort & Spa Dubai is situated on a pristine stretch of private beach overlooking the Arabian Gulf and with 500 rooms, caters to every type of traveler. With 14 international restaurants and bars, the hotel offers guests the world on a plate. Caracalla, the hotel’s Spa & Health Club, is the ideal retreat for mind and body. The pool and beach facilities are heaven for sunbathers and joggers.
